t: Amos 1

The*p words of Amos, who was among the sheepbreeders of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
And*p he said: “The*pn Lord*s roars from Zion, And*ld utters His voice from Jerusalem; The*ld pastures of the shepherds mourn, And*ld the top of Carmel withers.”
Judgment on the Nations
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they have threshed Gilead with implements of iron.
But*ld I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, Which*ld shall devour the palaces of Ben-Hadad.

I*ld will also break the gate*i bar of Damascus, And*ld cut off the inhabitant from the Valley of Aven, And*ld the one who holds the scepter from Beth Eden. The*ld people of Syria shall go captive to Kir,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Gaza, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they took captive the whole captivity To*ld deliver them*i up to Edom.
But*ld I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza, Which*ld shall devour its palaces.

I*ld will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, And*ld the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon; I*ld will turn My hand against Ekron, And*ld the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,” Says*ld the Lord God.*s

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Tyre, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom, And*ld did not remember the covenant of brotherhood.
But*ld I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, Which*ld shall devour its palaces.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Edom, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld he pursued his brother with the sword, And*ld cast off all pity; His*ld anger tore perpetually, And*ld he kept his wrath forever.
But*ld I will send a fire upon Teman, Which*ld shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of the people of Ammon, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they ripped open the women with child in Gilead, That*ld they might enlarge their territory.
But*ld I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, And*ld it shall devour its palaces, Amid*ld shouting in the day of battle, And*ld a tempest in the day of the whirlwind.
Their*ld king shall go into captivity, He*ld and his princes together,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Amos 2
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld he burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime.
But*ld I will send a fire upon Moab, And*ld it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth; Moab*ld shall die with tumult, With*ld shouting and*i trumpet sound.
And*ld I will cut off the judge from its midst, And*ld slay all its princes with him,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Judgment on Judah

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they have despised the law of the Lord,*s And*ld have not kept His commandments. Their*ld lies lead them astray, Lies*ild which their fathers followed.
But*ld I will send a fire upon Judah, And*ld it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”
Judgment on Israel

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “For*pn three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I*ld will not turn away its punishment,*i Because*ld they sell the righteous for silver, And*ld the poor for a pair of sandals.
They*ld pant after the dust of the earth which*i is*i on the head of the poor, And*ld pervert the way of the humble. A*ld man and his father go in to the same*i girl, To*ld defile My holy name.
They*ld lie down by every altar on clothes taken in pledge, And*ld drink the wine of the condemned in*i the house of their god.

“Yet*ln it*i was*i I who*i destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose*ld height was*i like the height of the cedars, And*ld he was*i as*i strong as the oaks; Yet*ld I destroyed his fruit above And*ld his roots beneath.
Also*ld it*i was*i I who*i brought you up from the land of Egypt, And*ld led you forty years through the wilderness, To*ld possess the land of the Amorite.
I*ld raised up some of your sons as prophets, And*ld some of your young men as Nazirites. Is*ild it*i not so, O you children of Israel?” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“But*ld you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And*ld commanded the prophets saying, ‘Do*ld not prophesy!’
“Behold,*ln I am weighed down by you, As*ld a cart full of sheaves is weighed down.
Therefore*ld flight shall perish from the swift, The*ld strong shall not strengthen his power, Nor*ld shall the mighty deliver himself;
He*ld shall not stand who handles the bow, The*ld swift of foot shall not escape, Nor*ld shall he who rides a horse deliver himself.
The*ld most courageous men of might Shall*ld flee naked in that day,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Amos 3
Authority of the Prophet’s Message
Hear*p this word that the Lord*s has spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying:
“You*pn only have I known of all the families of the earth; Therefore*ld I will punish you for all your iniquities.”
Can*ln two walk together, unless they are agreed?
Will*ld a lion roar in the forest, when he has no prey? Will*ld a young lion cry out of his den, if he has caught nothing?
Will*ld a bird fall into a snare on the earth, where there is no trap for it? Will*ld a snare spring up from the earth, if it has caught nothing at all?
If*ld a trumpet is blown in a city, will not the people be afraid? If*ld there is calamity in a city, will not the Lord*s have done it?*i
Surely*ln the Lord God*s does nothing, Unless*ld He reveals His secret to His servants the prophets.
A*ld lion has roared! Who*ld will not fear? The*ld Lord God*s has spoken! Who*ld can but prophesy?
Punishment of Israel’s Sins

“Proclaim*pn in the palaces at Ashdod, And*ld in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say: ‘Assemble*ld on the mountains of Samaria; See*ld great tumults in her midst, And*ld the oppressed within her.
For*ld they do not know to do right,’ Says*ld the Lord,*s ‘Who*ld store up violence and robbery in their palaces.’”
Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “An*pn adversary shall*i be*i all around the land; He*ld shall sap your strength from you, And*ld your palaces shall be plundered.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “As*pn a shepherd takes from the mouth of a lion Two*ld legs or a piece of an ear, So*ld shall the children of Israel be taken out Who*ld dwell in Samaria— In*ld the corner of a bed and on the edge of a couch!
Hear*ld and testify against the house of Jacob,” Says*ld the Lord God,*s the God of hosts,
“That*ld in the day I punish Israel for their transgressions, I*ld will also visit destruction*i on the altars of Bethel; And*ld the horns of the altar shall be cut off And*ld fall to the ground.
I*ld will destroy the winter house along with the summer house; The*ld houses of ivory shall perish, And*ld the great houses shall have an end,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Amos 4
Hear*pn this word, you cows of Bashan, who are*i on the mountain of Samaria, Who*ld oppress the poor, Who*ld crush the needy, Who*ld say to your husbands, “Bring wine,*i let us drink!”
The*ld Lord God*s has sworn by His holiness: “Behold,*ld the days shall come upon you When*ld He will take you away with fishhooks, And*ld your posterity with fishhooks.
You*ld will go out through*i broken walls,*i Each*ld one straight ahead of her, And*ld you will be cast into Harmon,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“Come*ln to Bethel and transgress, At*ld Gilgal multiply transgression; Bring*ld your sacrifices every morning, Your*ld tithes every three days.
Offer*ld a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven, Proclaim*ld and*i announce the freewill offerings; For*ld this you love, You*ild children of Israel!” Says*ld the Lord God.*s
Israel Did Not Accept Correction
“Also*pn I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, And*ld lack of bread in all your places; Yet*ld you have not returned to Me,” Says*ld the Lord.*s

“I*ln also withheld rain from you, When*ld there*i were*i still three months to the harvest. I*ld made it rain on one city, I*ld withheld rain from another city. One*ld part was rained upon, And*ld where it did not rain the part withered.
So*ld two or*i three cities wandered to another city to drink water, But*ld they were not satisfied; Yet*ld you have not returned to Me,” Says*ld the Lord.*s

“I*ln blasted you with blight and mildew. When*ld your gardens increased, Your*ld vineyards, Your*ld fig trees, And*ld your olive trees, The*ld locust devoured them;*i Yet*ld you have not returned to Me,” Says*ld the Lord.*s

“I*ln sent among you a plague after the manner of Egypt; Your*ld young men I killed with a sword, Along*ld with your captive horses; I*ld made the stench of your camps come up into your nostrils; Yet*ld you have not returned to Me,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“I*ln overthrew some*i of you, As*ld God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, And*ld you were like a firebrand plucked from the burning; Yet*ld you have not returned to Me,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“Therefore*ln thus will I do to you, O Israel; Because*ld I will do this to you, Prepare*ld to meet your God, O Israel!”

For*ln behold, He*ld who forms mountains, And*ld creates the wind, Who*ld declares to man what his thought is,*i And*ld makes the morning darkness, Who*ld treads the high places of the earth— The*ld Lord*s God of hosts is*i His name.
Amos 5
A Lament for Israel
Hear*p this word which I take up against you, a lamentation, O house of Israel:
The*pn virgin of Israel has fallen; She*ld will rise no more. She*ld lies forsaken on her land; There*ild is*i no one to raise her up.
For*p thus says the Lord God:*s “The*pn city that goes out by a thousand Shall*ld have a hundred left, And*ld that which goes out by a hundred Shall*ld have ten left to the house of Israel.”
A Call to Repentance
For*p thus says the Lord*s to the house of Israel: “Seek*pn Me and live;
But*ld do not seek Bethel, Nor*ld enter Gilgal, Nor*ld pass over to Beersheba; For*ld Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, And*ld Bethel shall come to nothing.
Seek*ld the Lord*s and live, Lest*ld He break out like fire in*i the house of Joseph, And*ld devour it,*i With*ld no one to quench it*i in Bethel—
You*ld who turn justice to wormwood, And*ld lay righteousness to rest in the earth!”

He*ln made the Pleiades and Orion; He*ld turns the shadow of death into morning And*ld makes the day dark as night; He*ld calls for the waters of the sea And*ld pours them out on the face of the earth; The*ld Lord*s is*i His name.
He*ld rains ruin upon the strong, So*ld that fury comes upon the fortress.
They*ln hate the one who rebukes in the gate, And*ld they abhor the one who speaks uprightly.

Therefore,*ld because you tread down the poor And*ld take grain taxes from him, Though*ld you have built houses of hewn stone, Yet*ld you shall not dwell in them; You*ld have planted pleasant vineyards, But*ld you shall not drink wine from them.
For*ld I know your manifold transgressions And*ld your mighty sins: Afflicting*ld the just and*i taking bribes; Diverting*ld the poor from*i justice*i at the gate.
Therefore*ld the prudent keep silent at that time, For*ld it is*i an evil time.
Seek*ln good and not evil, That*ld you may live; So*ld the Lord*s God of hosts will be with you, As*ld you have spoken.
Hate*ld evil, love good; Establish*ld justice in the gate. It*ld may be that the Lord*s God of hosts Will*ld be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
The Day of the Lord

Therefore*p the Lord*s God of hosts, the Lord, says this: “There*ipn shall*i be*i wailing in all streets, And*ld they shall say in all the highways, ‘Alas!*ld Alas!’ They*ld shall call the farmer to mourning, And*ld skillful lamenters to wailing.
In*ld all vineyards there*i shall*i be*i wailing, For*ld I will pass through you,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Woe*ln to you who desire the day of the Lord!*s For*ld what good is*i the day of the Lord*s to you? It*ld will*i be*i darkness, and not light.
It*ld will*i be*i as though a man fled from a lion, And*ld a bear met him! Or*ld as*i though*i he went into the house, Leaned*ld his hand on the wall, And*ld a serpent bit him!
Is*ild not the day of the Lord*s darkness, and not light? Is*ild it*i not*i very dark, with no brightness in it?
“I*ln hate, I despise your feast days, And*ld I do not savor your sacred assemblies.
Though*ld you offer Me burnt offerings and your grain offerings, I*ld will not accept them,*i Nor*ld will I regard your fattened peace offerings.
Take*ld away from Me the noise of your songs, For*ld I will not hear the melody of your stringed instruments.
But*ld let justice run down like water, And*ld righteousness like a mighty stream.
“Did*ln you offer Me sacrifices and offerings In*ld the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
You*ld also carried Sikkuth your king And*ld Chiun, your idols, The*ld star of your gods, Which*ld you made for yourselves.
Therefore*ld I will send you into captivity beyond Damascus,” Says*ld the Lord,*s whose name is*i the God of hosts.
Amos 6
Warnings to Zion and Samaria
Woe*pn to you who*i are*i at ease in Zion, And*ld trust in Mount Samaria, Notable*ld persons in the chief nation, To*ld whom the house of Israel comes!

Go*ld over to Calneh and see; And*ld from there go to Hamath the great; Then*ld go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are*ild you*i better than these kingdoms? Or*ld is their territory greater than your territory?
Woe*iln to*i you who put far off the day of doom, Who*ld cause the seat of violence to come near;
Who*ld lie on beds of ivory, Stretch*ld out on your couches, Eat*ld lambs from the flock And*ld calves from the midst of the stall;
Who*ld sing idly to the sound of stringed instruments, And*ild invent for yourselves musical instruments like David;
Who*ld drink wine from bowls, And*ld anoint yourselves with the best ointments, But*ld are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
Therefore*ld they shall now go captive as the first of the captives, And*ld those who recline at banquets shall be removed.
The*ln Lord God*s has sworn by Himself, The*ld Lord*s God of hosts says: “I*ld abhor the pride of Jacob, And*ld hate his palaces; Therefore*ld I will deliver up the*i city And*ld all that is in it.”
Then*p it shall come to pass, that if ten men remain in one house, they shall die.

And when a relative of*i the*i dead,*i with one who will burn the*i bodies,*i picks up the bodies to take them out of the house, he will say to one inside the house, “Are*i there*i any more with you?” Then*p someone will say, “None.” And*p he will say, “Hold your tongue! For we dare not mention the name of the Lord.”*s
For*pn behold, the Lord*s gives a command: He*ld will break the great house into bits, And*ld the little house into pieces.
Do*ln horses run on rocks? Does*ld one*i plow there*i with oxen? Yet*ld you have turned justice into gall, And*ld the fruit of righteousness into wormwood,
You*ld who rejoice over Lo Debar, Who*ld say, “Have we not taken Karnaim for ourselves By*ld our own strength?”

“But,*ln behold, I will raise up a nation against you, O*ld house of Israel,” Says*ld the Lord*s God of hosts; “And*ld they will afflict you from the entrance of Hamath To*ld the Valley of the Arabah.”
Amos 7
Vision of the Locusts
Thus*p the Lord God*s showed me: Behold, He formed locust swarms at the beginning of the late crop; indeed it*i was*i the late crop after the king’s mowings.
And so it was, when they had finished eating the grass of the land, that I said: “O*pn Lord God,*s forgive, I pray! Oh,*ld that Jacob may stand, For*ld he is*i small!”
So*ild the Lord*s relented concerning this. “It*ld shall not be,” said the Lord.*s
Vision of the Fire
Thus*p the Lord God*s showed me: Behold, the Lord God*s called for conflict by fire, and it consumed the great deep and devoured the territory.
Then I said: “O*pn Lord God,*s cease, I pray! Oh,*ld that Jacob may stand, For*ld he is*i small!”
So*ild the Lord*s relented concerning this. “This*ld also shall not be,” said the Lord God.*s
Vision of the Plumb Line
Thus*p He showed me: Behold, the Lord stood on a wall made*i with a plumb line, with a plumb line in His hand.

And the Lord*s said to me, “Amos, what do you see?” And*p I said, “A plumb line.” Then*p the Lord said: “Behold,*pn I am setting a plumb line In*ld the midst of My people Israel; I*ld will not pass by them anymore.
The*ld high places of Isaac shall be desolate, And*ld the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste. I*ld will rise with the sword against the house of Jeroboam.”
Amaziah’s Complaint
Then*p Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
For thus Amos has said: ‘Jeroboam*pn shall die by the sword, And*ld Israel shall surely be led away captive From*ld their own land.’”
Then*p Amaziah said to Amos: “Go,*pn you seer! Flee*ld to the land of Judah. There*ld eat bread, And*ld there prophesy.
But*ld never again prophesy at Bethel, For*ld it is*i the king’s sanctuary, And*ld it is*i the royal residence.”
Then*p Amos answered, and said to Amaziah: “I*pn was*i no prophet, Nor*ld was*i I a son of a prophet, But*ld I was*i a sheepbreeder And*ld a tender of sycamore fruit.
Then*ld the Lord*s took me as I followed the flock, And*ld the Lord*s said to me, ‘Go,*ld prophesy to My people Israel.’
Now*ld therefore, hear the word of the Lord:*s You*ld say, ‘Do not prophesy against Israel, And*ld do not spout against the house of Isaac.’

“Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s ‘Your*pn wife shall be a harlot in the city; Your*ld sons and daughters shall fall by the sword; Your*ld land shall be divided by survey*i line; You*ld shall die in a defiled land; And*ld Israel shall surely be led away captive From*ld his own land.’”
Amos 8
Vision of the Summer Fruit
Thus*p the Lord God*s showed me: Behold, a basket of summer fruit.
And He said, “Amos, what do you see?” So*p I said, “A basket of summer fruit.” Then*p the Lord*s said to me: “The*pn end has come upon My people Israel; I*ld will not pass by them anymore.
And*ld the songs of the temple Shall*ld be wailing in that day,” Says*ld the Lord God—*s “Many*ld dead bodies everywhere, They*ld shall be thrown out in silence.”
Hear*ln this, you who swallow up the needy, And*ld make the poor of the land fail,

Saying:*p “When*pn will the New Moon be past, That*ld we may sell grain? And*ld the Sabbath, That*ld we may trade wheat? Making*ld the ephah small and the shekel large, Falsifying*ld the scales by deceit,
That*ld we may buy the poor for silver, And*ld the needy for a pair of sandals— Even*ld sell the bad wheat?”
The*ln Lord*s has sworn by the pride of Jacob: “Surely*ld I will never forget any of their works.
Shall*ld the land not tremble for this, And*ld everyone mourn who dwells in it? All*ld of it shall swell like the River, Heave*ld and subside Like*ld the River of Egypt.
“And*ln it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord God,*s “That*ld I will make the sun go down at noon, And*ld I will darken the earth in broad daylight;

I*ld will turn your feasts into mourning, And*ld all your songs into lamentation; I*ld will bring sackcloth on every waist, And*ld baldness on every head; I*ld will make it like mourning for an only son,*i And*ld its end like a bitter day.
“Behold,*ln the days are coming,” says the Lord God,*s “That*ld I will send a famine on the land, Not*ld a famine of bread, Nor*ld a thirst for water, But*ld of hearing the words of the Lord.*s
They*ld shall wander from sea to sea, And*ld from north to east; They*ld shall run to and fro, seeking the word of the Lord,*s But*ld shall not find it.*i
“In*ln that day the fair virgins And*ld strong young men Shall*ld faint from thirst.
Those*ld who swear by the sin of Samaria, Who*ld say, ‘As*ld your god lives, O Dan!’ And,*ld ‘As the way of Beersheba lives!’ They*ld shall fall and never rise again.”
Amos 9
The Destruction of Israel

I*p saw the Lord standing by the altar, and He said: “Strike*pn the doorposts, that the thresholds may shake, And*ld break them on the heads of them all. I*ld will slay the last of them with the sword. He*ld who flees from them shall not get away, And*ld he who escapes from them shall not be delivered.
“Though*ln they dig into hell, From*ld there My hand shall take them; Though*ld they climb up to heaven, From*ld there I will bring them down;

And*ld though they hide themselves on top of Carmel, From*ld there I will search and take them; Though*ld they hide from My sight at the bottom of the sea, From*ld there I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them;
Though*ld they go into captivity before their enemies, From*ld there I will command the sword, And*ld it shall slay them. I*ld will set My eyes on them for harm and not for good.”
The*ln Lord God*s of hosts, He*ld who touches the earth and it melts, And*ld all who dwell there mourn; All*ld of it shall swell like the River, And*ld subside like the River of Egypt.

He*ld who builds His layers in the sky, And*ld has founded His strata in the earth; Who*ld calls for the waters of the sea, And*ld pours them out on the face of the earth— The*ld Lord*s is*i His name.

“Are*iln you not like the people of Ethiopia to Me, O*ld children of Israel?” says the Lord.*s “Did*ld I not bring up Israel from the land of Egypt, The*ld Philistines from Caphtor, And*ld the Syrians from Kir?
“Behold,*ln the eyes of the Lord God*s are*i on the sinful kingdom, And*ld I will destroy it from the face of the earth; Yet*ld I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
“For*ln surely I will command, And*ld will sift the house of Israel among all nations, As*ld grain*i is sifted in a sieve; Yet*ld not the smallest grain shall fall to the ground.
All*ld the sinners of My people shall die by the sword, Who*ld say, ‘The calamity shall not overtake nor confront us.’
Israel Will Be Restored
“On*pn that day I will raise up The*ld tabernacle of David, which has fallen down, And*ld repair its damages; I*ld will raise up its ruins, And*ld rebuild it as in the days of old;
That*ld they may possess the remnant of Edom, And*ld all the Gentiles who are called by My name,” Says*ld the Lord*s who does this thing.

“Behold,*ln the days are coming,” says the Lord,*s “When*ld the plowman shall overtake the reaper, And*ld the treader of grapes him who sows seed; The*ld mountains shall drip with sweet wine, And*ld all the hills shall flow with*i it.*i

I*ld will bring back the captives of My people Israel; They*ld shall build the waste cities and inhabit them;*i They*ld shall plant vineyards and drink wine from them; They*ld shall also make gardens and eat fruit from them.
I*ld will plant them in their land, And*ld no longer shall they be pulled up From*ld the land I have given them,” Says*ld the Lord*s your God.
